title: Drawing, 1895–96
medium: Charcoal, black chalk, white chalk on heavy cream wove paper
markings: Stamped in ? ink, at right corner: Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper Union.
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in graphite, at top right: Sale 280. 
Verso: Inscribed in graphite, along right edge: (33).
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description: Sketch of the head and shoulders of sailor, wearing a wide-brimmed hat and holding a coat (a sou'wester), at right. Another sailor, nearly full-length, with left arm raised, is shown wearing rain hat and yelling. A sketch of clouds and sea appears at left.  Various notations at the margins.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1895–96.
1895–96. Charcoal, black chalk, white chalk on heavy cream wove paper. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-33.
